name: The Greatest Rubbed Wings
author: Serenityiscooking
summary: Great party wings whether you want football game day grabbers or just to get your cravings/desire/fix.
ingredients: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can cola soft drink (such as Coke®)
1 (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning (such as Goya®)
1 teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
1 tablespoon light brown sugar, or to taste
1 tablespoon BBQ seasoning (such as McCormick®), or to taste
1 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®), divided
directions: Combine wings and cola in a large bowl
Place in the fridge to marinate for 1 hour
Mix sazon seasoning, mustard, cayenne pepper, seafood seasoning, celery salt, brown sugar, and BBQ seasoning together for the rub
Mix wings thoroughly with 1/2 cup hot sauce, then toss in the rub to coat
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (218 degrees C)
Grease a broiler pan with cooking spray
Bake wings in the preheated oven for 30 minutes
Flip and continue baking until crispy, about 20 minutes more
Toss wings with the remaining hot sauce and return to the oven for 5 more minutes
